result.execSummary:
The defendant Trent A Varney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trent A Varney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Trent A Varney was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Court authorizes transfer to Iowa County.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Trent A Varney appeared by video, in custody at the Iowa County Jail.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Trent A Varney.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 1 and State will move to dismiss Ct 2. State recommends 10 days jail and court costs. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Ct 2 dismiss per agreement. State heard. Attorney Frank heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 10 days jail, to report forthwith, can serve in Iowa County, court costs, and to submit a DNA sample.

Defendant Trent A Varney appeared by video from Iowa County Jail.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by phone for Trent A Varney.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank indicated that this matter has been resolved and requesting plea/sentencing date. Court sets PLEAS - 10/26/22 at 3:30 pm. This can be held via zoom.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Review scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Trent A Varney in court, in custody at Iowa County Jail.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Trent A Varney.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank heard and defendant would like to waive prelim. Court verbally reviews waiver and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives right to preliminary hearing. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Attorney Frank heard. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charges. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Trent A Varney appeared by video, in custody from Iowa County Jail. Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Trent A Varney.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Attorney Frank has been retained. State requests a signature bond. Court heard and orders $1000 signature bond. Preliminary hearing date set.
Sent to Iowa Co. Jail 9-26-22 em
for leave to file additional motions
